content: 4 in 1 reversible beanie you know how it is when you want to knit a hat as a gift or for charity - do they prefer a fitted or slouchy hat will they like the stitch pattern will it fit well with this versatile reversible pattern you have four different options all from the same hat broken rib beanie with turn-up brim broken rib slouch beanie seed stitch beanie with turn-up brim seed stitch slouch beanie option 1 broken rib option 2 broken rib broken rib side close-up beanie with turn-up brim slouchy beanie option 3 seed stitch option 4 seed stitch seed stitch side close-up beanie with turn-up brim slouchy beanie great as a charity knit as gauge isn t important - the rib is stretchy widthways and the length is adjustable because of the turn up - and so fits almost any adult head another great plus is that it takes only one 100g ball of yarn and can be knitted up in just a few hours especially as unlike tradition ribbing every other pattern row is plain knit 1 materials 100g chunky/bulky yarn i used king cole tweed chunky in balmoral red tip i have found not all yarns labelled chunky/bulky are equal and you may need to adjust your needle size to suit the yarn you have 5mm circular needles us size 8 for knitting in the round tip i used a 24 /60cm cable and short 5mm tips so that i could just knit round and round and then changed to dpns during the decreases but you could use dpns or magic loop instead measurements hat approximately 10 /25cm from brim to crown when laid flat to fit adult abbreviations k =- knit p = purl sts = stitches k3tog knit three stitches together decrease two stitches cdd = centred double decrease of slip two together knitwise k1 pass slipped sts over alternate method of decreasing two stitches instructions cast on 80 sts and join to work in the round tip you may want to use a stretchy cast-on tip i like to cast on 81 stitches move the first cast-on stitch from the right needle to the left and bind off the extra stitch over the moved stitch then move the moved stitch back to the right needle if you then pull the ends up snug it makes a nice neat join in the round place marker for beginning/end of the round turn-up brim work about 2½ /6cm of k1 p1 rib in the round this works out around 12 rounds tip you can make this longer or shorter to suit yourself for example if you don t have much yarn you could do half this and omit the turn-up for a fitted beanie start broken rib pattern round 1 knit round 2 k1 p1 rib work these two rounds in pattern until total length is about 8 /20cm long tip you will need around 15 yards/13 5 metres of yarn to complete
